intro: Cestrum falcatum, commonly known as the yellow bell vine, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its long, slender stems and clusters of fragrant, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Cestrum falcatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
